llm.feedback:
Remove the “Main‑focus check” block and any other explanatory prose.  
For each of the four scenario lines, add a canonical‑handle clause that states the expected move on the asset (silver) with a magnitude range and sign, e.g. “silver: up 5‑10 % (LF0UUL917)”.  Follow the clause immediately with an explicit catalyst window: list the key dates (Fed meeting 16‑17 Aug, core PCE 30 Aug, NFP 31 Aug, 2‑yr/10‑yr spread 57 bp) and the data releases that will confirm the scenario.  Replace generic “Monitor Fed minutes, CPI, PCE, 10y yield spread” with those specific dates and releases.  Keep the probability citation (LF0UUL917) but ensure it is tied to the evidence cited.  

For the trade plan, keep the 10‑field format but insert a catalyst window in the Trigger field: “Fed minutes hawkish or CPI > 3.0 % (30 Aug)”.  In the Invalidation field, state “Fed rate hike or CPI drop (30 Aug)”.  Verify that Entry $39.00, Stop $37.00, Target $43.00, R/R 5:1, Probability 70 %, Confidence 80 are all numeric and consistent.  Remove any extraneous commas or placeholders.  Finally, ensure every line ends with a single probability and confidence figure and that all IDs are correct and referenced inline.
